intro: Verbesina cronquistii, commonly known as the Cronquist's beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, hairy leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gravelly soils. Verbesina cronquistii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
